text:
Edison Avenue, between Randall and Schley Avenues, showing the old J.D. Wolfe Mansion partially obstructing the continuity of the thoroughfare. The view is south.

July 1, 1928

P.L.Sperr

Another view of the J.D. Wolfe Mansion.

1920's

W.B.Vernon

A front view of the house.
This print is mounted on a separate mount.

E. P. Chrystie

Edison Ave, betw. Randall and Schley Aves, The old J.D. Wolfe mansion, front view.

Aug. 23, 1925

Edison Avenue, east side, between Randall and Schley Avenues, showing the J. D. Wolfe Mansion. The G. W. Bromley máf of 1900 shows the house to be located on the estate of George Bruce Brown.

June 1926.
©Brown Brothers

Edison Avenue, east side, between Randall and Schley Avenues, showing the Wolfe Mansion(Beers' 1867 map). Views 2 and 3 show the rear of the house. It partially obstructs the continuity of Edison Avenue.

P. L. Sperr
July 1, 1928
Views 1,2, 3
